content:
The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014, also known as the Small Business Act, authorizes the use of entrepreneurial development programs. The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014 authorizes the use of specific programs to support entrepreneurs, including entrepreneurial education, business incubation, growth acceleration, cluster development, and business training. This section does not apply to services for small businesses owned by an Indian. The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014 authorizes various programs to support entrepreneurs, such as entrepreneurial education, business incubation, growth acceleration, cluster development, and business training. An exception is made for services provided to assist small businesses owned by an Indian tribe. The Administrator is required to submit an annual report to the Committees on Small Business detailing all entrepreneurial development activities undertaken in the current fiscal year. This report must include descriptions and operating details of each program and activity. The Administrator must submit an annual report to the Committees on Small Business detailing entrepreneurial development activities in the current fiscal year, including program descriptions, operating details, grant award processes, awardees, funding amounts, and vendors. The Administrator must submit an annual report to the Committees on Small Business detailing entrepreneurial development activities, program descriptions, grant award processes, awardees, funding amounts, and responsible individuals for each program and activity. SEC. 3. MARKETING OF SERVICES.

Section 21 of the Small Business Act is amended to allow grant recipients to market their services without prohibition.

SEC. 4. CONFIDENTIALITY REQUIREMENTS.

Section 21(a)(7)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to include sharing information with State, local, Federal agencies, or third parties.

SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION. Section 21(a)(3)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to include governing data collection activities for grant recipients. Additionally, a new provision for an annual report on data collection is added to Section 21 of the Act. The Small Business Act is amended to include an annual report on data collection activities related to the Small Business Development Center program. SEC. 6. MATCHMAKING AND OTHER EVENTS. Amends the Small Business Act to allow Small Business Development Centers to collect fees from private partnerships and cosponsorships. SEC. 7. EQUITY FOR SBDCS. Amends the Small Business Act regarding equity for SBDCs. SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. The Administrator shall not award grants under this section to entities that did not receive grants prior to September 30, 2014. SEC. 9. DISASTER REFORMS. Section 21(b)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to provide assistance to out-of-state small businesses and authorize disaster recovery assistance through small business development centers. The Small Business Act is amended to allow a small business development center to assist small businesses outside the state affected by a declared disaster. The Small Business Act is amended to allow small business development centers to provide continuity of services in states affected by declared disasters under the T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act. The Small Business Act now allows small business development centers to access disaster recovery facilities to provide assistance in states affected by declared disasters. SEC. 10. Includes entrepreneurship training for unemployed individuals by amending the Small Business Act to educate and assist unemployed individuals in starting new businesses.
